UndoRedo Class Reference

#include <UndoRedo.h>

Collaboration diagram for UndoRedo:

[legend]

List of all members.

UndoRedo.cpp

UndoRedo-Singleton-Class handels all possible undo and redo operations that can be done within the application. It manages the stacks and calls the derived command-classes to un-/redo their operations

Date:
2008-10-29
Author:
Konstantin Balabin <k.balabin@googlemail.com>

Patrick Kracht <patrick.kracht@googlemail.com>

Thorsten Moll <thorsten.moll@googlemail.com>

Valentin Kunz <athostr@googlemail.com>

void UndoRedo::undo (  ) 

unexecutes the last command, pushed to the undo-stack

Definition at line 67 of file UndoRedo.cpp.

00068 {
00069         if (!m_undo.empty())
00070         {
00071                 // unexecute last command from undo stack and push on redo stack
00072                 Command* command = m_undo.top();
00073                 command->unexecute();
00074                 m_redo.push(command);
00075                 m_undo.pop();
00076         }
00077         
00078         // send event to enable redo button
00079         NotifyEvent gnrevent(wxEVT_COMMAND_GNR_NOTIFY);
00080         gnrevent.setGNREventType(SETREDOENABLED);
00081         gnrevent.SetInt(1);
00082         ProcessEvent(gnrevent);
00083         
00084         // send event to diable undo button if undo-stack is empty
00085         if (m_undo.empty())
00086         {
00087                 NotifyEvent gnrevent(wxEVT_COMMAND_GNR_NOTIFY);
00088                 gnrevent.setGNREventType(SETUNDOENABLED);
00089                 gnrevent.SetInt(0);
00090                 ProcessEvent(gnrevent);
00091         }
